title: Ruling on fasting 6 days of Shawwal before making up missed days of Ramadan fasts? assim al hakeem
transcript: is asking about the ruling on fasting the six days of sha before making up M days of Ramadan most likely this is what people frequently ask about and it's an issue of dispute and the most safest and authentic opinion according to the Hadith is that you have to first make up the days M of your Ramadan which is a higher priority without any doubt it's a f then you fast the six days of shaal which is a recommended Sunnah but to reverse this and other Scholars say that this would not attain you the reward because the Hadith is clear whoever fasts Ramadan and follows that by fasting six days of the month of shaal then Allah would Grant him the reward of fasting the whole entire year so this is a Hadith that's conditional you have to fast Ramadan first skipping a day or two would not mean that you've fasted Ramadan therefore you have to make them up and then fast the six days of sha and this is highly recommended Sunnah Anna from
